result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Scott Belott

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon Scott Belott in court.  Attorney Gloria V Rodriguez in court for Brandon Scott Belott pro hac vice, under the supervision of Attorney Mark Shaw, who appears by zoom. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF591/22CF619/22TR3828-3830. Victim rights compliance. Attorney Rodriguez advises the Court that they still have not received the discovery from the State. ADA Huber requests the defense file a discovery demand and will need an email address for Attorney Rodriguez as most of the discovery is sent via email. Court will adjourn to allow the defense time to request and review the discovery. Attorney Rodriguez requests that Attorney Shaw be excused at the next pretrial hearing; Court grants request for reasons set forth on the record. TR cases continue to trail.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Rodriguez.  Clerk. M.Burke. Motion for Pro Hac Vice. Court approves the motion for pro hac vice and allows Attorney Gloria Rodriguez to represent the DE with the supervision of Attorney Mark Shaw.
Notice of Motion to Modify Bond condition
from the court re: Judicial Rotation 8/1/22

Defendant, Brandon Scott Belott, appeared with Attorney Gloria Rodriguez.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Rodriguez reports to the Court she has filed pro hac vice paperwork ; WI Bar has deposited check and opened a portal but not assigned a number yet this morning.  DE indicates to the Court he wants to proceed to prelim hearing today with Atty Rodriguez.   Court allows Atty Rodriguez to appear today.      DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.


At completion of hearing a bar number had been assigned to Atty Rodriguez
Motion For Admission Pro Hac Vice

Adjustment Number: 22A 296424,
Payable Number: 342335,
Receipt Number: 22R 014515,
Amount: $20.00

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No drug paraphenalia.

01:28 PM  
  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Glora Rodriguez.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 5/19/22 @ 10:00am.  $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk
and witness list filed by the State
